newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Mycom plans cash raising via bond issue.
newsitem.headline: Mycom plans cash raising via bond issue.

text.p: Malaysia's Mycom Bhd has proposed a fund raising exercise to raise 150 million ringgit to be used to build palm oil mills, cultivation of oil palm and for land improvement.

The exercise will involve an issue of 150 million ringgit worth of bonds with detachable warrants, and an offer for sale and private placement of the warrants, Mycom said in a statement issued by its merchant bankers.
It plans to issue the five-year redeemable bank guaranteed unsecured bonds with a coupon rate of 2.0 percent, with 50 million detachable warrants on a bought deal.

The diversified firm would then put up for sale the provisional allotment of 49.085 million warrants by the primary subscriber to Mycom shareholders on a one-warrant for every eight shares basis at a price to be determined later.
The remaining 914,740 warrants will be placed out privately by the primary subscriber at a price to be determined.
The proposals will need regulatory and shareholders' approvals.
Mycom is involved in gaming, hotel, property investment and development, plantations and stockbroking.
